content.description: the big corner offwidth on flowstone. Bring humungous gear and know how to climb limestone trad or you might hurt yourself. 1st pitch is 5bolts on easy ground to shale ledge and 2x12mm anchor

climbs.name: that freeman, hardy and willis acid

content.description: off the shale ledge, step R off the anchor to a short wall ,crossing the offwidth and L wards into a steep overhanging groove. keep going then meet Skin bridge for its weird topout. 3 bolts to belay off. Walk off R to the abseil of Wrangles original.

Off the shale ledge, step L round the arete as for English Rose, but head R via thin moves on immaculate limestone to the meet the arete via a final hardish move and finish up a mental groovy corner system thing to a dispersed 3bolt anchor

THE line up the middle of the main wall. Easy bit then move L on a small ledge to a steepish section, then slab and thin crack to hideous roof moves. Finish at a double bolt belay to lower off with 70m rope. There is an option to summit via the corners of "English Rose" with one more bolt to a single 12mm anchor and green camalot back up. Walk off R to  Wrangels Original finish to rap off.
content.location: main wall, follow the shiny shinies

content.description: after 1st easy pitch of Wrangels Original belay off the 2 12mm abseil bolts. climb back and around the arete on to the face by an airy move to a bolt. This protects moves to the hand crack proper. Follow this perfect crack to the base of the corner and wider easier crack to a small rsting ledge and onwards up loose corner , one more bolt to a trad belay on large loose ledge with one 12mm fixe ps. Walk off R to the abseil as for Wrangels Original.

trad and sport routes upto 50m. 5.8 to 5.11 single and double pitch. Loose bottom band to stellar middle band which deteriorates again at the top. Akin to Dolomites / UK trad limestone/  Sea Cliffs. Loose in places, bring helmet and expect occasional exploding blocks. A great escape from El Paso! If it ever gets traffic and cleans up, would be a really nice crag. (unlikely given general local apathy!)
